nd.name: No Drain
nd.description: Water level fails to drop below Reset Level within 15 mins.
nd.troubleshooting: Check drain hose for blockage/kinks, clean drain filter, verify drain pump operation.

LO.name: Door Unlock Failure
LO.description: Door fails to unlock after 3 attempts.
LO.troubleshooting: Power reset, check door latch/lock mechanism, inspect wiring to door lock.

nF.name: No Fill
nF.description: Water fill continues for >16 mins or no change in water level for 3 mins.
nF.troubleshooting: Check water supply valves, inlet hoses, inlet filters, and water pressure.

FL.name: Door Lock Failure
FL.description: Door fails to lock after 3 attempts.
FL.troubleshooting: Ensure door is fully closed, inspect door lock assembly and wiring.

nF1.name: Water Connection Error
nF1.description: Hot/Cold water connection is not correct.
nF1.troubleshooting: Verify hot/cold hoses are connected correctly and valves are open.

LeE.name: Water Level Sensor Trouble
LeE.description: Input signal from water level sensor is out of range.
LeE.troubleshooting: Inspect pressure hose for leaks/blockage, check water level sensor connections.

LE.name: Water Level Sensor Trouble
LE.description: Input signal from water level sensor is out of range.
LE.troubleshooting: Inspect pressure hose for leaks/blockage, check water level sensor connections.

OF.name: Overflow
OF.description: Water level is at or above overflow level.
OF.troubleshooting: Turn off water supply, check inlet valve stuck open, inspect water level sensor.

dc.name: Unbalanced Load
dc.description: Unbalance or cabinet bump detected during final spin.
dc.troubleshooting: Redistribute laundry evenly, reduce load size, retry spin cycle.

E2.name: EEPROM Fault
E2.troubleshooting: Power reset, reprogram PCB if applicable, replace control board if persists.

E2.name: Jammed/Stuck Key
E2.description: Key input signals detected for more than 30 seconds.
E2.troubleshooting: Clean control panel, check for stuck buttons, replace keypad if needed.

dL.name: Door Open (Running)
dL.description: Door is detected as open when the motor is operating.
dL.troubleshooting: Stop cycle, close door firmly, inspect door switch and wiring.

dS.name: Door Open (Locking)
dS.description: Door is detected as open while trying to lock the door.
dS.troubleshooting: Check door alignment, inspect lock actuator and harness.

bE.name: Motor Sensor Error
bE.description: Motor hall sensor signals sent without motor operation.
bE.troubleshooting: Check motor hall sensor wiring, inspect motor PCB connections.

86.name: Temp/Resistance Error
86.description: Abnormal high/low temperature or resistance (Thermal sensor or PBA).
86.troubleshooting: Check thermistor resistance, inspect heater and PCB connections.

E3.name: Motor Drive Error
E3.description: MICOM driving motor but no response from hall sensor (Locked/Defective/Overload).
E3.troubleshooting: Check motor for overload, inspect hall sensor, test motor windings.

Sr.name: System Relay Failure
Sr.description: Main Relay Failure (PCB does not notice relay operation).
Sr.troubleshooting: Inspect main relay on PCB, check solder joints, replace PCB if faulty.

Hr.name: Heater Relay Failure
Hr.troubleshooting: Check heater relay operation, wiring, and PCB output signals.

3E.name: Over-current Detected
3E.description: Motor won't turn; IPM detects over-current.
3E.troubleshooting: Inspect motor for mechanical jam, check IPM and motor wiring.

2E.name: Voltage Error
2E.description: Voltage for motor control bus is over or under specified limit.
2E.troubleshooting: Verify stable power supply, check internal power board and wiring.

8E.name: MEMS Sensor Failure
8E.troubleshooting: Power reset, inspect MEMS sensor and PCB connections.

7E.name: Silver Care Kit Failure
7E.troubleshooting: Check Silver Care PCB connections, replace module if required.

PF.name: Power Failure
PF.troubleshooting: Inform user, resume cycle if possible, ensure stable power supply.

SUdS.name: Suds Detected
SUdS.troubleshooting: Reduce detergent amount, use HE detergent, run rinse cycle.

Sd.name: Suds Detected
Sd.troubleshooting: Reduce detergent amount, use HE detergent, run rinse cycle.
